title: mrquackquack
author: mrquackquack
content: I don't know if anybody remembers coinsmarkets and what all happened but to the ones that do and also that don't here you go.You're welcome.https://bitcoinsmarter.net/coinsmarkets/#

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: I'm not sure I understand what you're trying to get across? Did you want to reminisce? or are you implying that coinsmarkets themselves are behind the website? because we would need a stronger evidence for that as websites gets copied a lot without permission.

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: Quote from: mrquackquack on October 17, 2022, 10:12:48 AMI don't know if anybody remembers coinsmarkets Is that Coinmarkets.io?I can't access that website and it says, "Connection denied by IP2Location Country Blocker" it might be what you meant the link that you gave above was the alternative one right?No offense but why the link that you gave doesn't have a record of who.is?

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Quote from: sheenshane on October 17, 2022, 11:14:15 PMIs that Coinmarkets.io?I can't access that website and it says, "Connection denied by IP2Location Country Blocker" it might be what you meant the link that you gave above was the alternative one right?No offense but why the link that you gave doesn't have a record of who.is?It was coinsmarkets.com. I'm not entirely sure if they had another domain but most likely not given how their exchange screamed tight budget. What happened back then was coinsmarkets exit scammed but they first tried to stall users by giving loads of excuses which went for weeks or months (?) until they finally went MIA, see this mega thread about it: CoinsMarkets.com IS DOWN!

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: Potato Chips on October 17, 2022, 03:46:41 PMI'm not sure I understand what you're trying to get across? Did you want to reminisce? or are you implying that coinsmarkets themselves are behind the website? because we would need a stronger evidence for that as websites gets copied a lot without permission.I tried visiting CoinsMarkets.com, and it redirects to OP's bitcoinsmarter.net/coinsmarkets. I think there's a connection. What is even more weird is that bitcoinsmarter.net looks like an exchange too. It might be a scam on top of another scam

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on October 18, 2022, 08:37:25 PMI tried visiting CoinsMarkets.com, and it redirects to OP's bitcoinsmarter.net/coinsmarkets. I think there's a connection. What is even more weird is that bitcoinsmarter.net looks like an exchange too. It might be a scam on top of another scam  It could be that someone took over. I just don't think that coinsmarkets who took their time to stall users before disappearing completely would show up using their old name-- because the redirect links them with one another. But yeah, a quick look at bitcoinsmarter.net and it screamed shady af lol.

comments.author: MainIbem
comments.body: This is not the regular coinmarketcap, the spelling is wrong coinsmarket instead of coinmarket so there should be something fishy over there and or maybe could be another website which they trying to build an exchange from the images website looking more of an exchange.Sell and buy and withdrawal as well which doesn't look user friendly.Please everyone be warned of this type of website and exchange.
